text: hi everyone cliff Inigo aptana here the

time for review of the new KO dot record

rock band fronted by songwriter singer
multi-instrumentalist just experimental
music workhorse tobe driver there was
quite a bit of knowledge experience and
ability at Toby's disposal in his
musical projects it shows with the wide
array of fantastic musicians that he's
worked with over the years it shows in
all the genres that he's explored in Ko
Dada chamber music experimental and
avant-garde metal death metal
progressive rock and jazz fusion all of
these flavors actually turning up on the
band's last full-length record Bardot
quite a long record and an ambitious
record to compositionally and
conceptually with a very strange story
running congruently through all of the
tracks there are a variety of vocal
styles on this record a variety of
genres as I just said there are some
intense spots and loud spots some
absolutely gorgeous moving and beautiful
spots on this thing too but all of this
ability often in my opinion drives kayo
da and Toby into maybe a little too much
indulgence or maybe even negligence
because we do have records like coyote
and Gamma Knife whose production is
seriously underwhelming and just a
little too low fight a completely
complement the ambition and the musical
style on these albums I absolutely do
appreciate that these records are not
over produced in the way that a lot of
progressive metal and progressive rock
albums these days are but under
production is not really all that
preferable either however in the case of
Hvar doe that records recording was
stellar but as I said occasionally it
could be kind of long-winded or just
have some really unrewarding musical
passages or just some lackluster vocal
performances maybe they go on assuming
something is a little more interesting
than it is because it's may be different
than what the last track was doing or
it's a relatively new sound for them in
this feeling of adventure
over quality that I get on Keo dots
records was just a little confirmed for
me the moment I put this album on from
there just from the opening track
because it became very apparent very
quickly that this wasn't gonna just be a
progressive rock album it wasn't just
gonna be a progressive metal album or an
experimental rock album we are
essentially getting some prog mixed with
some darkwave some gothic rock with a
generous helping of synthesizers of
course it is not surprising to hear the
longest track as the first track on this
entire record the track can be a little
challenging but not necessarily for the
right reasons the synthesizers are a
little high in the mix they're kind of
farty they sound gaudy the false set of
vocals the watery guitars the kind of
start/stop groove that this thing is
riding on their characteristics about
this track I don't really care for but
the song at the core of this music to me
is is actually not that bad and this
song does do a good job of I guess
setting the tone and the flavor of this
record this song essentially works in
three parts with some sudden crescendos
erupting at the 4 and the 8 minute marks
both changes are great but just before
they occur the band starts just border
on sounding kind of mundane mostly
because I feel like they continue to
pile one on top of the other some
progressive rock it's some goth rock
cliches sometimes the music just sounds
a little too self-absorbed and on top of
it the vocals while impassioned can come
off just a little ghoulish this song
could take a little while to digest
I recommend listening to a more than one
time especially if you're into goth rock
or progressive rock but the next track
on here off-ramps cycle pattern 22 the
vocals here are so unbelievably
amateurish and the instrumentation in
the background just continues to cycle
over a lot of the same grooves who's the
needle person and the very finish of
this song sounds like a comedic ly
spooky synth rock odyssey while there
are moments on this record that I like
there are a lot of aspects to these
songs like I said that they just border
on me
taking these tracks sort of intolerable
and when I'm not getting vocals that I
just don't really care for sometimes the
band is repeating through musical pieces
without that much progression or tension
like with the song library subterranean
I like the end of this track the very
hard-hitting odd time progressive rock
riffs all over this track are really
fiery as they start but as they continue
I feel like things just lose intensity
I think this track could have used just
a little bit more than some screaming

interesting the only thing really
keeping this part of the song alive to

amazing
now with the song that I heard first off
of this record assassination of Adam
fantastic track most aggressive track on
the entire record really noisy walls of
guitars and drums I love the downstroke
guitar riffs on this thing really
pummeling great groove but there are
moments where the sort of low fire
recording of this track holds back the
intensity of the noisy instrumentation
when I go into a Khao da record it's
it's just so weird because there's so
many things that I like there's so many
things I admire there's so many things I
think are top-notch and fantastic but
then there are things that I don't care
for at all or really just ruin a track
for me and what's funny is that it's
never the same thing it's never one
thing I can never predict what it is I'm
going to like or dislike about a Keo dot
song this vocal performance isn't that
good the recording here is just okay
this part is mixed really weird this
parts a little repetitive this parts a
little long-winded but on the flip side
here's a captivating melody there are
some great guitar playing there are some
amazing drumming the record ends sort of
as long-winded as it began but maybe
with not as interesting writing or as
compelling a performance but I still
came away from this record liking much
of what I heard I guess as long as Toby
and Kay ODOT continue to adventure and
experiment I will always be interested
in hearing what they do next because it
will be different it will be refreshing
in some way shape or form
Kyodai is pretty good at keeping me
